comments:
In 3.3 M5 for clients making use of the tabbed properties view.

For every selection change event, you get an SWTException in TabbedPropertyTitle. The title bar looks broken as colors are missing. The exceptions do not break anything, they just fill the log.

This is as a result of the API breakage in Bug 174441.
*** Bug 174484 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #0)
> The exceptions do not break anything, they just fill the log.

I've seen breakage when I click around between the ProjectExplorer, Java Editor, and Outline view.  I will get to a point where the ProjectExplorer appears to no long repaint.  Like if I click on a folder to expand it, nothing happens.  If I minimize Eclipse and then bring it back up, Project Explorer looks blank.
*** Bug 174510 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #0)
> In 3.3 M5 for clients making use of the tabbed properties view.
> 
> For every selection change event, you get an SWTException in
> TabbedPropertyTitle. The title bar looks broken as colors are missing. The
> exceptions do not break anything, they just fill the log.
> 
> This is as a result of the API breakage in Bug 174441.
> 

This bug breaks the property editor in the JSF Tools Project. I request this be fixed for M5.

Anthony, I read your first comment as indicating that if bug 174441 were to be fixed then this bug would also be fixed. Can you see any reason that I shouldn't mark it as a DUP of bug 174441 ?

I'm feeling pro-active today so I'm going to add this as a dup...feel free to un-dup if I've mis-interpreted your initial comment, thanks.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 174441 ***

Amy, Gerry, 

Can you tell me why this issue is a show stopper type issue with WTP.

I my testing, you get an SWTException in the log and the colours do not appear in the tabbed properties view title bar.

Is it because elsewhere in WTP you are catching the exception?

My scenario in comment #2 only uses views/editors from Eclipse, not WTP.  I can actually get the Project Explorer to stop painting by just clicking back and forth between that view and the Java editor.  If you close all instances of the Project Explorer (it may be open in other perspectives) and then reopen, repaint should start working again.

It may have to do with the fact that the Project Explorer uses the tabbed properties sheet whereas the Java editor uses the non-tabbed properties sheet.  Here's another more specific scenario:
1. open the resource perspective (you should get the project explorer view)
2. open the properties view
3. create a new java project (make sure you don't switch to the java perspective and stay in the current one)
4. create a new java class "package1.package2.MyClass"
5. put cursor in java editor
6. click on java project in project explorer
7. repeat steps 5 & 6 about 2 times
8. you will notice that when you click in the java editor, myproject will stay brightly selected (not grey) in the project explorer (like project explorer still has focus)  this indicates the project explorer has stopped redrawing and if you try to click on anything else in that view, it is nonresponsive.  Minimizing and restoring the eclipse window will get you a blank Project Explorer.

I've also run into cases where the Outline view stop drawing as well.  I feel this is an issue in WTP because the main WTP perspective, J2EE perspective uses the Project Explorer.  I can see users easily running into this issue because it's common for a user to click around between the editor and the explorer.

OK, I have confirmed the issue in the resource perspective in 3.3 M5 and the project explorer view. The project explorer view does take advantage of the tabbed properties view and becomes empty in with this issue.

Here is the stack trace using Amy's case
